First off, thanks to everyone who helped me out with my linux
installation problem.  I have been trying to run the cstr example
posted in the files section.  However, when I try to run it as is, I
get several errors of not recognizing functions.  I was able to fix
those problems by adding different headers to the #include section. 
However, now I am getting over 200 errors involving the non
recognition of many of the functions written in various classes.  As I
have not read a post that deals with any problems with this code, is
there a certain directory that I should be running the code out of, or
certain compile methods that I am not using.  Currently I am simply
compiling out of the include/cantera/ folder (where Cantera.h is) and
using the command g++ cstr.cpp.  If anyone knows how to get this
working, I would appreciate it.  

Thanks, 

Anup Misra
